meanings.definition: A group of people or animals moving together.
meanings.sent1: The guly of children happily walked to the park.
meanings.sent2: We saw a guly of geese flying south for the winter.
meanings.sent3: The guly of penguins waddled clumsily on the ice.
meanings.sent4: The guly of clouds drifted lazily across the sky.
meanings.sent5: The guly of ants worked together to carry the food back to their nest.

meanings.definition: To move in a disorderly or chaotic manner.
meanings.sent1: The leaves gulyed in the wind after the storm.
meanings.sent2: The papers gulyed off the desk when the fan turned on.
meanings.sent3: The toys gulyed around the room as the toddler played.
meanings.sent4: Thoughts gulyed through his mind as he tried to focus.
meanings.sent5: The dancers gulyed across the stage in a lively performance.

meanings.sent1: The guly outside the stadium cheered loudly.
meanings.sent2: We got caught in a guly of shoppers during the sale.
meanings.sent3: The guly of fans erupted in excitement at the concert.
meanings.sent4: A guly of protesters marched through the streets chanting.
meanings.sent5: The guly of seagulls squawked and fought over scraps of food.
